meanings.sent1: The fallen tree branch occluded the path through the forest.
meanings.sent2: She used her hand to occlude the sunlight from entering the room.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to occlude the view by hanging upside down from the tree.
meanings.sent4: His loud laughter occluded the speaker's voice during the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog occluded the entire city, making it impossible to see beyond a few feet.

meanings.definition: To close up or shut off
meanings.sent1: The chef had to quickly occlude the leaking sauce bottle to prevent a mess.
meanings.sent2: He decided to occlude the window with curtains to keep the room dark for sleeping.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to occlude the box and make it disappear.
meanings.sent4: The dam was built to occlude the river and control the water flow.
meanings.sent5: She used a bandage to occlude the wound and stop the bleeding.

meanings.sent1: The security guard tried to occlude the intruder from entering the building.
meanings.sent2: The closed gate occluded any vehicles from passing through the entrance.
meanings.sent3: The clever cat tried to occlude the dog's path by sitting in the middle of the hallway.
meanings.sent4: The thick walls of the fortress occluded any attempts of invasion.
meanings.sent5: The password protection was set up to occlude unauthorized access to the computer system.
